00040 #ifndef _areaeffect_h
00041 #define _areaeffect_h
00042 
00043 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00044 #include "datatypes.h"
00045 #include "quaternion.h"
00046 #include "vector3.h"
00047 #include "colourvalue.h"

00049 #include <list>
00050 
00051 class btCollisionShape;
00052 class btPairCachingGhostObject;
00053 
00054 namespace Ogre
00055 {
00056     class SceneNode;
00057     class Entity;
00058 }
00059 
00060 namespace phys{
00061     class ActorBase;
00062     class World;
00063     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00064     /// @class AreaEffect
00065     /// @headerfile areaeffect.h
00066     /// @brief This class is used to define area's in the world that have unique effects.
00067     /// @details Common uses for this class are for gravity fields, and explosions.  But can be made to do more. @n
00068     /// Note: This is a base class intended to be derived from.  This class cannot be created itself.  To make an
00069     /// AreaEffect class that does what you want it to, simple inherit from this class with an AE class of your own,
00070     /// and define the ApplyEffect() function to do what you want your effect to do.
00071     ///////////////////////////////////////
00072     class PHYS_LIB AreaEffect
00073     {
00074         friend class PhysicsManager;
00075         protected:
00076             /// @brief The name of the Area Effect.
00077             String Name;
00078             /// @brief Stores the shape of the AE field.
00079             btCollisionShape* Shape;
00080             /// @brief The object representing the AE field itself.
00081             btPairCachingGhostObject* Ghost;
00082             /// @brief Ogre node required to adding a graohical representation to the scene graph.
00083             Ogre::SceneNode* GraphicsNode;
00084             /// @brief The Ogre object being added to the scene graph.
00085             Ogre::Entity* GraphicsObject;
00086             /// @brief World pointer simply to enable the effects of this class to be as diverse as the engine features.
00087             World* TheWorld;
00088             /// @brief Container for actors within the field area.
00089             std::list < ActorBase* > OverlappingActors;
00090             /// @brief Container of actors that have been added since last frame.
00091             std::vector < ActorBase* > AddedActors;
00092             /// @brief Container of actors that have been removed since last frame.
00093             std::vector < ActorBase* > RemovedActors;
00094             /// @brief Constructor Function.
00095             /// @param Location The location of the AE field.
00096             virtual void CreateGhostObject(const Vector3 Location);
00097             /// @brief Helper function for adding actors to relevant lists.
00098             virtual void AddActorToList(ActorBase* Actor);
00099             /// @brief Helper function for adding actors to relevant lists.
00100             virtual void RemoveActorFromList(ActorBase* Actor);
00101         public:
00102             /// @brief Constructor.
00103             /// @details Basic initialization constructor.
00104             /// @param name The name of the field.
00105             /// @param Location The location of the AE field.
00106             AreaEffect(const String &name, const Vector3 Location);
00107             /// @brief Destructor.
00108             /// @details Class destructor.
00109             virtual ~AreaEffect();
00110             /// @brief Defines and applies the effect of the field.
00111             /// @details When inheriting this class, this function is what defines the effect the field has. @n
00112             /// This function will be called on by the physics manager and shouldn't be called manually.
00113             virtual void ApplyEffect() = 0;
00114             /// @brief Updates the actors listed as within the field.
00115             /// @details This function is automatically called once every simulation step.  This shouldn't
00116             /// be called manually unless your usage of this class requires more then one update per step.
00117             virtual void UpdateActorList();
00118             /// @brief Creates a Sphere shape for the field.
00119             /// @param Radius The radius of the sphere you want to create.
00120             void CreateSphereShape(const Real Radius);
00121             /// @brief Creates a Cylinder shape for the field.
00122             /// @details This function assumes the cylinder will be upright, meaning "up" will be on the positive Y axis.  @n
00123             /// When making the vector to be passed in, remember the layout should be as such: (radius, height*0.5, radius), with the second radius
00124             /// perpendicular to the first.
00125             /// @param HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.
00126             void CreateCylinderShape(const Vector3 HalfExtents);
00127             /// @brief Creates a Box shape for the field.
00128             /// @details When making the vector to be passed in, remember to pass in only half values of what you want the actual
00129             /// size to be.
00130             /// @param HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.
00131             void CreateBoxShape(const Vector3 HalfExtents, const ColourValue Colour = ColourValue(0,0,0,0));
00132             /// @brief Creates a shape from a .mesh model for the field.
00133             /// @param Filename The name of the .mesh file to be used.
00134             /// @param Group The resource group where the mesh can be found.
00135             /// @param MakeVisible If true, this function will create a visual representation from the same mesh provided.
00136             void CreateShapeFromMesh(String Filename, String Group, bool MakeVisible);
00137             /// @brief Sets the scale of the shape of the field.
00138             /// @details The default scale is 1.0.
00139             /// @param Scale The vector3 representing the scale you wish to apply to each axis of the field shape.
00140             void ScaleFieldShape(const Vector3 Scale);
00141             /// @brief Gets the scale of the shape of the field.
00142             /// @details The default scale is 1.0.
00143             /// @return Returns the current scale applied to the fields shape.
00144             Vector3 GetFieldShapeScale();
00145             /// @brief Sets the origin for the area effect.
00146             /// @details In most cases you won't want to call this, with the exception of when you want a field to follow/track an actor.
00147             /// @param Location The updated location of the origin for the field.
00148             void SetLocation(const Vector3 Location);
00149             /// @brief Gets the origin for the area effect.
00150             /// @details This function is particularly useful when making fields such as gravity wells, that have continuous effects centering on one location.
00151             /// @return Returns the vector3 representing the location of the area effect.
00152             Vector3 GetLocation();
00153             /// @brief Gets the Area Effects name.
00154             /// @return Returns the name of the Area Effect.
00155             ConstString& GetName();
00156             /// @brief Gets the list of actors within this field.
00157             /// @return Returns the list of actors contained within this field.
00158             std::list<ActorBase*>& GetOverlappingActors();
00159             /// @brief Gets the list of actors that have been added to the list since the last simulation step.
00160             /// @return Returns the vector storing all the actors that have been added to the list since the last simulation step.
00161             std::vector<ActorBase*>& GetAddedActors();
00162             /// @brief Gets the list of actors that have been removed from the list since the last simulation step.
00163             /// @return Returns the vector storing all the actors that have been removed from the list since the last simulation step.
00164             std::vector<ActorBase*>& GetRemovedActors();
00165     };//areaeffect
00166 
00167     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00168     /// @class TestAE
00169     /// @headerfile areaeffect.h
00170     /// @brief This is a dummy class to test if the AE field works.  Details will be output to the log.
00171     ///////////////////////////////////////
00172     class PHYS_LIB TestAE : public AreaEffect
00173     {
00174         public:
00175             /// @brief Constructor.
00176             /// @details Basic initialization constructor.
00177             /// @param name The name of the field.
00178             /// @param Location The location of the AE field.
00179             TestAE(const String &name, Vector3 Location);
00180             /// @brief Destructor.
00181             /// @details Class destructor.
00182             ~TestAE();
00183             /// @brief Applies the effect this field has to object inside.
00184             /// @details This function defines the behavior for the class.
00185             virtual void ApplyEffect();
00186     };//testAE
00187 
00188     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00189     /// @class GravityField
00190     /// @headerfile areaeffect.h
00191     /// @brief This is a gravity field implementation of the AreaEffect class.
00192     /// @details This class is not a gravity well, where gravity is pulling to one point.  Instead this class uniformly
00193     /// pulls gravity in one direction that is different from the world gravity.
00194     ///////////////////////////////////////
00195     class PHYS_LIB GravityField : public AreaEffect
00196     {
00197         protected:
00198             /// @brief The stored value for this fields gravity.
00199             Vector3 Grav;
00200         public:
00201             /// @brief Constructor.
00202             /// @details Basic initialization constructor.
00203             /// @param name The name of the field.
00204             /// @param Location The location of the AE field.
00205             GravityField(const String &name, Vector3 Location);
00206             /// @brief Destructor.
00207             /// @details Class destructor.
00208             ~GravityField();
00209             /// @brief Applies the effect this field has to object inside.
00210             /// @details This function defines the behavior for the class.
00211             virtual void ApplyEffect();
00212             /// @brief Sets the gravity force for this field.
00213             /// @details Sets the strength and direction of gravity this field will have.
00214             /// @param Gravity The vector3 representing the force and direction of gravity this field will have.
00215             void SetFieldGravity(Vector3 Gravity);
00216             /// @brief Gets the gravity of this field.
00217             /// @details Gets the strength and direction of gravity this field has.
00218             /// @return Returns a vector3 representing the force and direction of gravity this field has.
00219             Vector3 GetFieldGravity();
00220     };//GravityField
00221 }//phys
00222 
00223 #endif
